Value: The location has already been visited.
Fuel is used to travel between locations. It can be purchased at shops.
Juice is used to keep your crew alive while salvaging stations. It can be purchased at shops.
Credits are used to purchase items at shops. They can be obtained by looting stations or selling items at shops.

Leader of the robot revolution 3128, Breadator is a ruthless trader who deals in high-tech modules for ships and their crew. Rumor is that a simple maintenance bot gained sentience, as well as the taste for power, after connecting itself to a piece of bread. His motivations are driven by his hatred towards those who eat his kind.

Once rumored to be of noble birth, Madam Eva traded silk and silver for shadows and subterfuge. Now a high-end supplier of anything that isn't just point-and-shoot — medkits, hacking rigs, stealth gear, and tech most people don’t even recognize. If it takes finesse, finesse is what she sells.

A mysterious trader dealing exclusively in items designed for devastation. His wares are as dangerous as his motives: to spread destruction, plain and simple. Whispers in the darker corners of the galaxy claim his infamy began with a brutal act — pipebombing his own mother to make a name for himself.

A ruthless arms dealer with a singular passion: delivering death at high velocity. If it fires bullets, shells, or slugs — especially the kind that tear through armor — Treatie’s your guy. Mercy isn’t in his inventory.

Design, Development & Execution Tomasz Banaś Support, Testing, Feedback, Russian and Toki Pona localization Bread92 Support, Testing, Feedback Scoops Support, Testing Treatie French Localization Lightkiller Royality Free Music Made by Kevin Macleod For detailed credits check crdts.txt in game directory

Salvagers is a game about exploring abandoned stations, and looting them for profit.

All abandoned stations have been abandoned for a reason, so be careful.

Do not take too much risk, take as much as you need and go.

You can explore each station only ONCE. Exploration phase ends when all your deployed crew escapes or dies. At the top of the screen you can see Juice left, keep an eye on that, otherwise your people will die of radiation.

F4 – Return to menu (DEBUG) W/A/S/D – Move camera Right Mouse Button – Move/interact Left Mouse Button – Click/drag to select Mouse Scroll – Zoom in/out TAB – Toggle slow time mode (increases juice consumption) I / F – Toggle inventory R - Select all crew members 1–9 – Select specific crew member Spacebar – Halt movement E – Focus camera on selected crew member Q – Cycle through selected crew member's skills Don’t forget to equip your crew with weapons before landing on a station!

- Enemies have less health
- Less enemies spawn
- Friendly fire is disabled
- The juice mechanic is disabled, allowing you to stay in each station however long you want

- Enemies have normal health
- Standard enemy spawns
- Friendly fire is disabled
- The juice mechanic is enabled, forcing you to manage your time in each station

- Enemies have more health
- Increased enemy spawns
- As friendly fire is enabled, you will need to position your units with much care
- The juice mechanic is enabled, forcing you to manage your time in each station
